data.title: Filmed in New Mexico
data.meta_description: Movie and television productions in New Mexico
data.text:
Ace in the Hole (1951)

AKA: The Big Carnival, Billy Wilder's Ace in the Hole, Thirty, The Human Interest Story (working title). Drama involving newspaperman Kirk Douglas using the story of a man trapped within the cave-in of some Indian ruins to regain his career. Directed by Billy Wilder. Filming locations in Albuquerque, Laguna Pueblo, and landscapes around New Mexico, with bulk of film shot near Gallup.

Adventures of a 7th Grade Dragonslayer (2010)

AKA: I Was a 7th Grade Dragonslayer, Adventures of a Teenage Dragonslayer. Adventure/comedy about a young man who may be able to defeat a dragon that threatens all humankind. Starring Lea Thompson, Wendie Malick, Amy Pietz, Eric Lutes, Andrew Lauer, and Hunter Allan. Filming locations around Albuquerque and Rio Rancho.

After Earth (2013)

Science fiction. A man and his son cope with a crash-landing on an alien planet. Scenes at Spaceport America. Starring Will Smith and Jaden Smith.

Afterwards (2008)

Drama about a lawyer who meets a man who claims he can accurately predict when someone will die. Starring Evangeline Lilly, John Malkovich, Romain Duris, Lars Engstrom, and David Rigby. Filming locations: Alamogordo, Albuquerque, Jemez Springs, Tularosa, and White Sands National Monument.

All the Pretty Horses (2000)

Drama involving two cowboys in Mexico, one of whom falls for a wealthy rancher's daughter. Based upon the book of the same name by Cormac McCarthy. Directed by Billy Bob Thornton; starring Matt Damon, Henry Thomas, Lucas Black, Penelope Cruz, Bruce Dern, Sam Shepard, Joaquin Phoenix, Rubén Blades, and Miriam Colon. Filming locations: Abiquiu (Chama river, Plaza Blanca), Bonanza Creek Ranch, Charles R Ranch (near Las Vegas), Cook Ranch/Silverado Set, El Rancho de las Golondrinas, Ghost Ranch, Las Vegas, Ruby Ranch (near Las Vegas), Las Vegas, San Jose, Santa Fe (State Penitentiary), Taos (Rio Grande Gorge), Zia Pueblo.

All the World is Sleeping (2021)

Drama. Written and directed by Albuquerque native Ryan Lacen. Filmed around Las Cruces, based on the experiences of seven New Mexico women dealing with challenges including drug addiction.

Ambush (1949)

Western about a man recruited to find a woman who has been taken by Apaches. Starring Robert Taylor, Chief Thundercloud, John Hodiak, Arlene Dahl, John McIntire, and Leon Ames. Filming locations: Red Lake (Navajo Reservation), Red Rock State Park (Gallup).

Americana (2023)

Crime thriller revolving around a rare Lakota Ghost Shirt coming onto the black market. Set in South Dakota, principal filming in New Mexico. Written and directed by Tony Tost. Starring Sydney Sweeney, Paul Walter Hauser, Halsey, Eric Dane, Zahn McClarnon.

The American Dreamer (1971)

Documentary about Dennis Hopper filmed while he was developing his own film, The Last Movie. Filmed around Los Alamos and Taos.

An Alien History of Planet Earth (2005)

Documentary, released in the UK as UFOs: The Secret Evidence and in the US as part of the "UFO Files" series. Narrated by writer Nick Cook. Filming locations: Alamogordo (NM Museum of Space History), Dulce, White Sands National Monument (Missile Range).

An Angelic Attitude (1915)

Silent, one-reel Western shot around Las Vegas. The Selig Polyscope company shot many such films around Las Vegas, all of them starring Tom Mix who also wrote the films. His leading lady was Victoria Forde, whom he later married.

And God Created Woman (1987)

Drama directed by Roger Vadim; a remake of his own earlier work ... Et Dieu Créa La Femme (1956). The story revolves around a woman who escapes from prison and affects the men she encounters. Starring Rebecca De Mornay, Vincent Spano, Frank Langella, Donovan Leitch, and Judith Chapman. Filmed around Santa Fe.

And Now Miguel (1953)

Black & white docudrama written and directed by Joseph Krumgold, involving a sheepherding family in Los Cordovas in northern New Mexico. Filmed around Los Cordovas (near Ranchos de Taos) and the nearby Sangre de Cristo mountains. Krumgold later turned the script into a children's novel of the same name which won the Newbery Award in 1954. Starring Miguel Chavez, Bonifacio Chavez, Eli Chavez, Blas Chavez Sr., Blas Chavez Jr., Gabriel Chaves.

And Now Miguel (1966)

Color remake of the 1953 version, and buoyed by the success of the book based upon the earlier script (both by Joseph Krumgold). Starring Pat Cardi, Michael Ansara, Guy Stockwell, and Clu Culager. Filming locations: Abiquiu, Ghost Ranch, San Ildefonso Pueblo, Santa Fe.

Appaloosa (2008)

Western drama based upon the book of the same name by Robert B. Parker, part of the series about characters Virgil Cole and Everett Hitch. Starring Viggo Mortensen, Renée Zellweger, Ed Harris, Jeremy Irons, and Lance Henriksen. Filming locations: Abiquiú Dam, Algodones, Bonanza Creek Movie Town, Cerro Pelon Ranch (Galisteo), Diablo Canyon (Santa Fe), La Madera/Palovista Ranch (Rio Arriba County), Lamy, San Cristobal Ranch (Galisteo).

The Arc (1991)

Drama about a young man who goes on a trip of self-discovery in the desert. Starring Ash Adams, Catherine Fogarty, Grigori, Brian Hemmingsen, Larry Holden, and Mary Lodge. Filming locations. Albuquerque, Bernalillo, San Ysidro, Zia Pueblo.

Arizona (2018)

Dark Comedy. A realtor's life is thrown awry after she witnesses a murder. Starring Danny McBride, Rosemarie DeWitt, Lolli Sorenson. Filmed in Arizona, California, and around Albuquerque.

Armageddon (1998)

Science fiction; a team of drillers are called upon to counter a doomsday asteroid. Scenes shot at the Very Large Array west of Socorro. Starring Bruce Willis, Billy Bob Thornton, Liv Tyler, Ben Affleck, Will Patton, Peter Stormare, Keith David, Owen Wilson, Steve Buscemi.

Around the Bend (2004)

Family drama involving four generations of men forced to face one another while on a road trip in New Mexico. Starring Michael Caine, Christopher Walken, Glenne Headly, Josh Lucas, and Preston Marsh. Filming locations: Albuquerque, Bernalillo, Bonanza Creek Movie Ranch, Los Lunas, Moriarty, Quarai at Salinas (Salinas Pueblo Missions National Monument).

Athletic Ambitions (1915)

Silent, one-reel Western shot around Las Vegas. The Selig Polyscope company shot many such films around Las Vegas, all of them starring Tom Mix who also wrote the films. His leading lady was Victoria Forde, whom he later married.

Atomic Gold (TV series, 2021)

Television series about the Noss family and their involvement with the legendary Victorio Peak Treasure on the White Sands Missile Range. Filming in Alamogordo, Carrlota Canyon, Hatch, Las Cruces, Santa Fe, and Truth or Consequences.

The Auction Sale of Run-Down Ranch (1915)

Silent, one-reel Western shot around Las Vegas. The Selig Polyscope company shot many such films around Las Vegas, all of them starring Tom Mix who also wrote the films. His leading lady was Victoria Forde, whom he later married.
